intro: Aulomyrcia surinamensis, commonly known as Surinam sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Guyana and Suriname. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with hairy stems and palmate leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. The species is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
